review: I mean, the food options are awesome if you like to eat heavy and yummy food. If you are decently healthy though, you might regret this hehe.

Chain, but probably one of the best tasting ones I've been too.  And better service then the others as well. Not that it's perfect. But they do the job. Reminds me of back in California and time spent with friends and family. My favorite is the onion ring tower, bottoml and the campfire sauce. Bomb!

Yeah, not impressed. Intended to go to another restaurant in the shopping center that was unexpectedly closed.  Arrived to Red Robin at 5:55 and explained the situation.  We asked if they could possibly accommodate a party of 12 around 6:30.  Was told it was no problem.  Waited outside and checked back in at 6:30.  Was told they had given away our tables because they were busy and we would have to wait longer.  Asked about how much longer at 7:00.  Was told 30-45 MORE minutes.  The manager walked up and asked me what I expected with a big party on a Friday night and told me they didn't take reservations.  Clearly there's a huge lack of communication in this restaurant.  No one ever apologized or acknowledged they confirmed they could accommodate us at 6:30, just treated us like we were in the wrong and were incredibly rude to us.  Poor communication.  Poor customer service.  Went around the corner to Cafe Adobe who told us we would have to wait 10 minutes and then sat us in 5.  Could have been a disaster on my birthday but thankfully Cafe Adobe saved the day.

I was told sit in the bar area. Took forever to get a drink and to order. Bartender / waiter was too busy chatting with co-workers and checking his phone. Got my appetizer and it was horrible. The chips were stale. The guacamole was old. Order a basic burger. The meat was over cooked, dry and tasteless. Hard to get a refill. Ask for mayo. Never got it. Horrible horrible service
The food was nasty and the hostess never acknowledged us when we walked in the door. She was too busy arguing with her coworker.

The manager here is awesome and the food was hot and wonderful!! Not to mention the staff was super friendly and nice!! We will be making this one of our regular stop not to mention our server Steffany was the boom dot com !!

Our waitress was on top of things! She was very accommodating and our food was delicious and was served very quickly, even with a full restaurant. Menu had a big variety of burgers, salads, and appetizers. Restaurant and restrooms were very clean!!! Will definitely go back!!

Good:  They have a great crispy chicken salad, that they have started serving in a large bowl which keeps the lettuce from falling off the edge of the plate (improvement). Bad:  Every time I order this salad, i have to ask for the garlic bread 4 or 5 times before they FINALLY bring it to the table, often as I am just finishing my salad.  What's the deal with making garlic bread?  It's irritating that this happens every time.

This location has definitely fell off.  I used to be a HUGE Red Robin's fan.  I have to admit the last two times I visited this location my burger just didn't taste right.  Today I ordered Sriracha shrimp as an appetizer and I didn't taste any Sriracha.  I was afraid to order another burger so I ordered Cluck and Shrimp, which is basically chicken strips, fried shrimp, & bottomless fries.  My fries weren't fresh.  MAJOR turn off.  Hubby ordered a well done burger & it was more medium than well.  I'm sorry, but 3 strikes and you're out.  I won't be back.   Omg, I forgot to mentioned the sweet tea we ordered.  It was more like colored water.  The manager asked us if everything was okay and we told him the tea was watered down.  I guess the waitress didn't like us complaining to the manager because when she returned with our new colored waters she slammed them on the table and didn't acknowledge when I said thank you.  No worries, she won't get a tip from me.

It was my first time ever eating here. I sat down and waited there for 20 minutes and only received a glass of water. The waiter was incredibly rude while taking my water order. I received better treatment at McDonald's, never coming here again.

Thank you Red Robin.  I love your food, your decor, your staff and your food.  As always, a great experience and with  very reasonable pricing.  See you next time.  Very important, motorcycle parking is a  GIANT plus.

I went here with my boyfriend and little sister. The place was not very busy. We order burgers. They taste better than decent and well made. The bottomless fries were a great value to the meal. We got 3 rounds of fries with attentive services!

Food is decent, service is terrible!!!  One star for refilling my soda without me asking and another for the food being decent. Where they lack is the service and cleanliness of the restaurant.  We were at Marqe on Christmas Day and decided to have lunch here. We walked in and were seated at a booth next to the door to get to the patio. Well, behind me were three bus boys just chatting away, without thinkibg that there was somebody behind them trying to enjoy a meal with his wife.  We decided to move to a booth down the aisle and noticed there was ranch dipping on the ground. I dont mean just a spot, but a handful on the floor. We were there 1.5 hours, and the ranch was there the entire time.  Well, we got to ordering as we were finally able to get some peace and quiet. We ordered the pretzel bites, which were pretty good, but the cheese sauce was bland.  For our entre we ordered a Keep It Simple (medium well) and a Whiskey BBQ with pepper jack (medium). The burgers were juicy, somewhat thick and flavorful. The fries are whatever.  The part that is the worst of our experience... we saw our waitress three times. Once when she took our drink order, next when she brought our drinks and took our main orders, and lastly when she brought our check. We were hoping to order the croissant doughnut things, but without us asking for a check, our waitress decided that we were done and she brought our check. Well RR, I am done with you, and will no longer be dining at your not so fine establishment.
Went to have a burger and sweet potatoes fries yesterday. The service was great, my order was accurate, and the waiter was very attentive.

Always great service at this location!! The food is always great for a decent price!!! My only complaint would be I you order a dinner salad... These new rectangular plates hard to keep your salad from getting on the table and impossible to mix all your dressing into the salad!!!  Red Robbin should go back to using the deeper round plates of old!!!

i didn't eat any burgers here but i got the fish and chips... i don't come here often but i thought i remembered this place being better especially the fries.  while the service was slow she tried and did as best she could.  maybe if i had gotten a burger it would have been better? the fries just seemed unappetizing.

Ive been meaning to try this out for a while and I finally realised there is one in Houston. I had the California chicken burger, plus and minus a few of the original toppings. as i was making it fit my dietary needs. They have a few different type of buns, including WHOLE GRAIN. The entrees all come with bottomsless fries and they also servce sweet potato fries. I had a couple bites on my bfs burger also. His was great. They get creative with thier toppings which i like. The service was pleasant. He was very informative about the menu and made great suggestions. The venue its self if clean. I would go back for sure.
25 minutes to cook a hamburger and onion rings and still not ready? Not even 4 tables occupied! Slow!!!!!!!!!!!

The burgers are great here no doubt about that. Slightly pricy but you get unlimited fries which I like to sneak into the theatre instead of buying popcorn haha. Interior is clean and restrooms usually clean. Why I didn't give 4-5 Stars is sadly the inconsistency of the service. Some trips the service is excellent food comes out fast with drinks and fries refilled without having to ask. Other visits you're empty on both for a good 5-15 minutes even whole asking for the refill. Understandable when busy but the latter happened when it was barely packed. The food is good here worth a go, just pray you get a good waiter/waitress.
Food came out hot and in a great amount of time. Server was somewhat attentive but could have been better. All in all I'd come back to this location
Bottomless steak fries with campfire and ranch sauce, mixed.  Need I say more? And try the freckled lemonade, bottomless as well.

Food and service was great; 4 star if you ask me.  But the experience was ruined by a visit to the bathroom just before leaving... Gross Alert: Nothing to upset your food experience like seeing a shiny, wet floor with what solids should have gone down the drain.

Very very good service and loved their food! I never had to ask for refills, someone always just gets me one. I like this place, two thumbs up from me and I recommend this to everyone! Also recommend the whiskey burger!

Pleasantly surprised! This was my first time to eat at a Red Robin.  My boyfriend and I were seated promptly and had a waitress in no time at all. We started our visit with the fried zucchini. Never had that before and it was good. Different from your regular appetizers. For my entree, I had the banzai burger. It was probably one of the best burgers I've ever had! Next time I'm going to have to try the turkey burger! Yum!

Me and my wife decided to stop and try this place .We were very disappointed the burger I had was small not like they say it is on TV and my wife ordered chicken fettuccine Alfredo and it was a few pieces of chicken with ramen noodles it sucked my wife was so disgusted she didn't eat her plate the drinks and waitress was very nice came to check with us we had read all the reviews warning us but we were hungry please don't waste your time or money at this place it sucks. I would rather eat green eggs and ham with a fox in a box with no socks lol then go back to this place.

We came here for drinks before a comedy show at the Improv.  The bar staff was attentive.  My 'skinny' margarita was pretty good.  It wasn't too sweet, which I like.  My husband's vodka Red Bull was inconsistent.  The first drink was nearly clear in color, the second definitely had more red bull than vodka. We ordered the hummus plate which was served with warm pita bread and cold grilled veggies.  It was a-ok.

Food was alright, limitless fries was a nice make up for it. I'd go here if i was indecisive and wanted an alright hamburger... Wing Sauce was good, our waitress did a good job, but she didn't make any funny jokes so that bummed me out. I'd recommend this restaurant to someone hosting a event such as little league trophy awards or naming the team MVP and making him eat as many fries as a challenge to  his buddy.

It was my first time at this particular red robin's and i had a great time! my waitress was wonderful and the food and drinks were great. i don't know if this will change the next time i go, i have heard that the service and quality of the food tend to fluctuate over here...we'll see. i love the ambience of the place, they have things to look at all over the walls and it's just a nice chill place for a good quick eat. fills you up, too!

Fifty-cent gluten free bun.  That's really all Red Robin did to make this a repeat destination for us, especially when we're en route to see a movie at the nearby Edwards.  Some places charge as much as $2 for the same swap, so when I saw the bill at the end of our first meal here, I was sold.  And the bun itself actually tastes pretty good and has a more standard texture than other GF buns we've tried. So, having said that...let's be real, this isn't fabulous foodie dining.  The food is reliable, in that generic chain-y way, but the service has always been cheerful and they do a great job of having information readily available about allergens in their food.  Husband's meals always come with an allergy alert and the kitchen knows not to put any of the seasoning on his fries, so he avoids the "inner turmoil" associated with back-of-house oopsies.  As it were. Again, nothing here is going to blow your mind, but the husband missed burgers pretty bad, and for fifty cents more than normal, he can have a regular experience.  I'm okay with going here once a month for that.

Crispy Artic Cod!!! I can't say enough about this wonderful sandwich. I was pleasantly surprised with this sandwich. I thought it would just be the average sandwich...but my God out was so much more! The slaw on the bread is perfectly crunchy and not wet. I couldn't really taste the tarter sauce and that's ok. Then you get to the crispy fish!!! My do Jesus!! It crunched every time I took a bite. The cod was light and the battery was light and crunchy. I was amazed with every bite and I told hubby a lot how much I liked this sandwich. Get THIS next time!!!

Waitress we had was good but when the food came out it was a real disappointment. I ordered a chicken salad, I had to send it back twice because there was moldy lettuce and carrots. When my son's fried fish finally came (15 min after everyone else got their orders) I cut it open so he would not get burned, the fish was raw! So I asked to speak with manager and he didn't handle the situation well. He gave an attitude and didn't apologize. Don't visit this location, if so, only get the burgers.

Sometimes you arrive a bit early or hungry after your movie, but what are your options without having to drive away? I've had the wings place near by but on this particular night I was craving for a burger and especially those bottomless fries!  My friend and I both got sat still an hour before closing so we didn't think we were being too much of a jerk.  After being sat we waited and waited for awhile until we got anyone to come to the table.  I think they had let too many servers go home early and then got hit by a wave of movie goers entering. The table behind us being complete dicks too.  Complaining about every little thing and overall just giving the waitress a hard time.   The fries here are what keeps me coming back because the burger itself was pretty bland and luke warm.

Our soup didn't come until dinner. I specially asked for no mayo and got it anyway. My burger didn't look anything like picture. All the burgers were skimped on sauce. Our refill if fries never came. So much for bottomless. We spoke to manger he offered to redo burgers but we starving by them. Not a good experience or value

We are regulars here and we are treated like family. Many of the staff have watched our kids grow and we are always so happy to come visit. The burgers are good and we really enjoy the bottomless fries. The new premium gourmet burgers are excellent.
Decent. Service was excellent and food was decent. It's nice reasonable standard food but nothing exceptional!

It wasn't Red and I didn't see a Robin but their food is yum! Went in after seeing X-Men with my bff. He ordered the turkey burger and I ordered the BBQ chicken sandwich (sauce on the side).  He loved the turkery burger - said it was tasty and cooked just right. The chicken sandwich was delish too. I did a little with the bbq sauce but the sandwich was yum without it.  The service was great even on a busy Saturday night and I would definitely go back! Thumbs up baby!

The management in this place is not great. I can tell by my experience here that the entire staff has poor connection with each other. The manager is also very rude. If I could give this place zero stars I would. My experience was so terrible I know if I wrote about it I'd rant way too long. Basically, the manager told me "if I was smart I wouldn't have asked to speak with her." The problem at hand was so minor, but she completely took it out of control. I've worked at Denny's before. I know customer service and how hard it can be to serve. I was not acting rude in any way. Maybe even too nice, but the manager for sure brought out my devil horns. You may go here and love the food, but it's upsetting to know that I'm supporting someone who is so terrible to their customers. I haven't and will not eat at any Red Robin for the rest of my life.

I am not a bit fan of Red Robin and never have been. The hamburgers are run through a salamander that gives a very standard product but it looses some of the character that an actual cook with a grill can give.  This Red Robin stands out a bit unique to me because I think it is probably the best option for dinner if you are going to the theater. I've been to a few other places in the Marque complex and I didn't like them at all. So when I go here, I just don't have the time to go somewhere better.

Alright I went there on Sunday I believe? It was my first time EVER... And wow... The drink I had was the pear lemonade. The first serving was great *sour btw for those who love tart*. The second serving had too much purple pear in it making it too sweet. Anyways then I had an appetizer, it has like little jalapeño bites and then at the bottom it has cheese sticks. One word-delicious. After that I had my nacho burger. It's not super huge, but it fills you up big time. I ordered the garlic fries, I wouldn't eat that on a first date lol it makes your breath stinky. They have this seasoning you can add to your burger and or fries. I only tried a little on my fries and it was great. Oh and I wish I had of noticed before we had our food, there's actually a QR code on the ketchup where you can play a game with your friends and family. The service was great no complaints!

Aside from the royal, the burgers are not savory enough. The meat is just sometimes too dry and stale. The addition of sunny side up egg eases the pain for me, and the all-you-can-eat order of steak fries even makes the meal better.

This is the first time I've been back to a red robin for a few years now. The place looks nicer and the menu definitely got revamped a bit. You no longer get a gigantic laminated menu but now you get a book.  I got their limited time berserker x burger. I guess it's to promote the new xmen movie. The burger overall was only ok. Patty was cooked well but didn't have much seasoning to it. The sriracha onion straws didn't really have that much of a spicy kick to it. However the aioli was tasty. They now give you dipping sauce for their bottomless fries. They have this one sauce that kind of tastes like chik fil a sauce. We also got the the nana nana moo moo shake. Though it was tasty because who doesn't like milkshakes it didn't blow our minds. Overall meal was ok but we did leave very full.

Very good burgers. This was my second visit. The first I did not have a burger but a salad which was also very good. I was not overly hungry so did not want a big Pappas, Fuddruckers or Whataburger. This burger was not very big but very good. However, if you are looking for a big burger like Fuddruckers or Pappas, etc. this is not the place for you. They do have bottom less fries, which make sure you ask for a basket when you order our burger because they bring out three bites with your burger and then by the time the next round arrives you are finished with your burger! I would recommend and it was very good.
Hey for a chain their burger is awesome! Great staff and fast service. The onion ring stack is also a good appetizer!

This place has a great menu and a good selection of burgers! This was my first burger in about four months...the Smoke & Pepper burger made me do it! It was so delectable and delicious! I was tasting it on my palette for an hour after I left. Very good burger! Nice staff and clean establishment.

Update-  Someone reached out right after I posted my review to say they would like me to talk with someone on their relations team. They said it could take up to 10 business days....... It's almost been a month.  I reached out to them again. Wish they would keep their word....
It was horrible, there was a cockroach hanging around by our table, I will never go there again. Hygiene is the most important thing in a restaurant.

Great Burger and Beer selection! Came in late afternoon on 3/2 the place was about 10% full we chose to sit at the bar and enjoy a few select drafts the glasses aren't frozen but they are chilled and the beer was ice cold. My beer of choice lately when I do drink beer has been the St. Arnold's and it didn't disappoint again. Started off with a bowl of the clam chowder it was meh I'm sure it comes in a bag from some food service supplier but it okay I don't think I would do it again but we really stopped in for a burger. Of all the choices I decided to keep it simple and went with a plain old fashion bacon cheese burger loaded with pepper-jack cheese. It was cooked to order medium and came out perfect. The restaurant was clean and the staff was very friendly I've forgotten the bartenders name but she was great. Since they weren't busy she carried on some good conversation while keeping busy doing her required tasks. We really enjoyed our meal and for a hamburger this place is okay I still prefer some of the up and coming burger places for the food but this place was convenient and they did a nice job I would come back if in the area.

This is nice for lunch with coworkers or if you are going to any movies or comedy show. I think the burgers are over priced but I never walk out hungry and the food has never made me feel bad. Maybe mentally bad from all the carbs and calories.

If I could give it no stars I would. Didn't even order anything. Walked in and smelled like the floors were mopped with toilet water. The table and chairs were sticky and filthy. The place was empty on a Friday evening. Inside the kitchen was quiet. Pitchers of drinks were just sitting on tables. The buser was adjusting himself while walking back to the kitchen. I couldn't eat there.
Always have great service.  Burgers are always perfect.  And the salads are darn good too.  Bottomless sweet potato fries are awesome too.  Perfect place to stop in before or after a movie.

Pretty good! Atmosphere was noisy! The waitress was sweet but all of them standing at the front was making us skeptical if service was raunchy. Kinda like a bad vid of harajuku girls. Our waitress, she was tidy and came around to check on us often. The wait time for a burger is easily 15 minutes. Getting drinks from the bar is about 5-8 minutes. Anyway, got the southern charm burger well done. Had a very juicy and flavorful pattie topped with BBQ sauce cheese, caramelized onions, bacon, arugula and a bit of celery and a sprinkle of brown sugar on toasty chibatta bread! Soooo good! I got sweet potato fries and tried the garlic herbed fries. First batch with burger the fries were cool. Second batches(refills) they were piping hot! Yey~! Also sipped the fire ball/bomb peach drink. Not a fan of how it was too sweet but friend ordered it and liked it. Overall good experience. Heartburn totes worth it lol

It's been a while since I've been to this restaurant. The service was wonderful. Our waiter was friendly and attentive (Hugo). The manager even walked around to make sure everything was good. At that time I've inly had the fries so I told her it was excellent. When I got to the burger, it wasn't what I expected. I had ordered a bacon cheese burger with pineapple. The problem here is that the burger was supposed to be gourmet, yet my bacon was chewy. If you're a bacon lover like me you want your bacon cooked perfectly where it's crispy so u can taste it in every bite. The bacon that was in my burger made me chew and put as I was taking a bite of my burger, creating a hot mess. I wouldn't be back for the burgers. The fries were delicious, hot and bottomless.

Server Vanessa was great, this is the third time this year that we had a small issue, and the manager never even bothers to come to the table, talk about lazy. What a disgrace to be a manager of an establishment and think so little of your guests that you can't be bothered by them, well princess manager needs to come down from his ivory tower and address us peasants, or we just will not come back.

Burger and sandwich joint, part of a large chain. Food is good, servers are good, ambience is bar food. Lots of different types of burgers and sandwiches, some plated foods too. Salads and soups and appetizers pushed as well. Similar to Fridays and other bar food restaurants. WiFi does not work. Connected once for a few minutes and then couldn't reconnect again. No place to plug in a laptop or other device to recharge.
Disgusting.  Gnats attacking me as I eat. Slow service. Water taste like garbage.  Never again.

I debated before I came here, I had stomach pain and you know the burger always a little oily. Believe it or not I feel much better after I ate some onion rings, fries, and lettuce wrap burger. It was yummy, service was good.  And I would be coming back here for sure. Try the milk shake they are really good, make sure to ask with NO sprinkles because they make the drink a little too sweet!

Why do these places change the menu just to make changes. They use to have a top notch Caesar salad but no more. I came for the burgers but my wife loved the Caesar salad but  NO. CANT HAVE THAT. last time we come here. Too bad. I'm sitting here enjoying the burger but my wife isn't happy. They could have at least offered to chop up some Romain and make a salad. It's after the lunch rush and the place is empty.

Unlimited fries, drinks and a delicious burger. What more can you ask for?  Almost all specialty burgers comes with a side of bottomless fries. You can choose from garlic fries or regular fries. If you don't want a side of fries you can always switch it to a side of broccoli, fruits or something else. If you wanted onion rings then it would just be 1 serving. But since I'm a college student, you know I'll be getting my money's worth.  I got the chili chili burger with ghost pepper sauce on the side. This sauce was AMAZING, if you like spicy ask them for this on the side. I dipped my fries in it as well and it was heavenly. But note that I'm one of those people that would order the spiciest wings at Buffalo Wild Wings that usually come with a label saying "caution: may irritate skin." We also tried the garlic fries, but they were okay. Just get the regular fries and add some of Red Robin's special seasoning on it.  One word to describe the customer service, perfect. The best I've ever had. First time here and I'll definitely be coming back.

I ordered this after Big Bellys Burger kept hanging up on me before I even placed my order.  This place had a lady who took my order, told me the price, and told me that it will be ready in 20 minutes.  I gave it 4 stars because of the service.   Red Robin is also pretty good.  They really did come through in the end for us to have a great lunch. EDIT: My family ordered from here again, and got BAD service.  They forget one of our sandwiches, and the guy said, "are you SURE we didn't put it in the bag?"  ???  You think we're lying?  SMH!  We showed him our whole bag, and he then realized that THEY messed up our order.

Way overpriced burgers.  There are so many great places to eat in the area for your money.  For a chain, it's ok but with so many more options this will be probably the last time I eat here.  If in the area, just yelp restaurants and go find better.  $14-15 for a burger???  Piss off!
It use to be great, still good, but they increased prices and reduced food portion sizes to small. You're paying more for far less.

How can this Red Robin be so much more "yucky" than all the other Red Robins in the Houston area combined?  I don't get it. Some of the food delivered to our table was cold; some was burned.  Some didn't come out of the kitchen at all.  The waitress kept telling us it was "almost done, sorry" but I had to go to the manager to find out she'd DROPPED the food.  20 minutes later my son's food showed up when everyone else was well into their meal. Tableware was dirty. Service was poor, at best. Even the quality of the food (like the burgers) was under par compared to the other locations where we LOVE their burgers. Fries were undercooked, not crisp and over seasoned. Don't go to this location.  Seriously - just don't!

Bummer! I've been a long time Red Robin fan and I am super disappointed. Let's start with the positives. The #namethatchicken was delicious and the bottomless fries are always good. The end.  The service was pretty much awful. The kid wasn't overly friendly but whatever. He was inattentive. Our drinks were empty and my husband's burger came out without the extra patty he ordered. Shouldn't you check that before you get to the table? So it got sent back, along with his fries of course, so he got to sit and watch me eat (yes, I shared my fries but come on). The waiter disappears.  Meanwhile, we order more drinks from the friendly curly haired waitress who stopped by to pick up my empty glass. When he finally reappeared with my husband's food we get a nonchalant "Sorry about that." And a "Oh, you're finished?" After he notices my empty plate. Yes, after 15 minutes my burger and shared fries are gone. PS where are the drinks we ordered and could we maybe get another basket of fries?  Oh and, it was my birthday and I told him I said wanted to use my Red Robin Rewards for my free birthday meal. Somehow this got mucked up because I ordered the wrong kind of burger so we just got 20% off. Ok, fine, but shouldn't you have mentioned that when I ordered? I feel like he should've.  I'm bummed. I love their food, however overpriced, but we won't be back.

So the service was very good.  Pretzel bites were ehhhhh. Not too great but well portioned for $5.  The colossus burger...   Pretty terrible. The chopped brisket was very rubber and not a good addition to the burger.  The burger itself was not good at all. Zero flavor from the burger. It was like eating sawdust I was expecting so much more when the server asked how I would like my burger cooked. But my requested Medium burger came out like a hockey puck. And similar flavor.  The only reason why this was two stars was service.

Nope. Nope. Nope. Nope. Nope! Never again! My first and last time trying this place. My burger tasted like air. And my fries had a weird taste to them. I had the o let stomach ache after eating here. The drinks were ok but the food was trash. Please don't waste your time there are far too many restaurants in Houston to waste your time spending $60 on cardboard.

The burgers are good, but the fries are meh.  This is really sad since they have bottomless fries (meaning you can keep getting more!)  One thing I enjoy getting here is the bottomless rootbeer float.  For $5 I tend to make it through three before I regret my actions.  I'd suggest this place for when you want to hang out with friends for a while, not when you want to grab a quick bite.   Note to self... I really should try the onion rings one day...

I'm not much of a burger fan so I don't think much of my opinions matter. Anyway I decided to try it out. The waitress was really sweet despite my friends being pretty demanding. The variety of flavors and type of burgers along with the toppings was nice. My dumbass forgot my debit card and they were happy to return it. Honest and cordial staff

First time visit to this chain and I have to say that I was impressed. Our server was very attentive and quickly got anything we needed. Our drinks never went below 25% full before another was on the way without even having to to ask.  The food was great and arrived quicker than expected. It was fresh and cooked perfectly which is not always the case with other burger places.  I would recommend for a quick but reliable, casual lunch or dinner.

If you have to wait for your movie to start this place is one of your very few options. Our server was very friendly and nice. The burgers are okay but not anything too memorable. I don't even remember what I got. The endless fries are fluffy and piping hot! They were really enjoyable.  We had a good dinner and movie date night but I wouldn't really come here again to find a "good burger" but for a chain, it's a-ok!

Ate again at Red Robin on July 4th afternoon. Service was much better, but still a little slow on taking orders and bringing drinks. Food was quick to come out and was hot and tasty. I will be back again. I appreciate that Red Robin contacted me to express their concern. They care about good service. I feel sure they will work out the kinks.

When coming to the Marq'E theatre, I'm frequently challenged of where to eat.  More often than not, I am meeting friends here who have gluten allergies, and this is the nearest place that can accommodate them. Red Robin is located right across the walkway from the theater entrance.  Furthermore, if you buy a ticket and then go to Red Robin, they will discount your meal $2.  WHO KNEW THAT?!?!  I just found that out this weekend while attempting to check in here via Yelp.  (Sometimes, Yelp does not have all businesses listed, hence this review.) For the fact that they have delicious bottomless fries, smaller burgers for my smaller stomach, GF options, and $2 off with your movie ticket, I will continue coming here.  Red Robin FTW.

The food was good the burger was great the fries tasted old though service was bad worst than the first visit here our server would disappear especially when are drinks were empty didn't even ask us how was the food I definitely would not recommend this establishment to anyone and I definitely will not be returning

Went to Red Robin for the first time ever during lunch today. It was not packed or full by any means. We were seated right away but for some reason the service was SLOW for really no one being in there. They were definitely I feel staffed quite well for not many customers.  We ordered an onion tower and it was ok. I think it was a little too crispy and tasted a little like it was cooked in old grease or something. It was decent though. We ordered our food which was a whiskey burger and then some snack buffalo bites. It took quite awhile to get the food out. I started to look and could see the buffalo bites sitting (and not under the heat lamps either) for a good 7-10 minutes before one of the gentleman running food brought it out.  The bites were not appetizing AT ALL. They were overcooked and the extra sauce they brought with it looked awful. The sauce was separating and looked like it had a layer of oil on top. We even tried mixing it and it didn't work. I showed the waitress and asked for another one and the second one she brought was just as bad. Needless to say it wasn't touched. We were done eating and sitting there waiting for her to come pick up the checks and she just stood there behind the bar on the phone with another employee until I was about to get up and bring it to her. I don't really see the reason why the service was so poor and the food when it wasn't even that busy. I WOULD NOT recommend eating here :( yuck

Okay it's been a min since I've visited this location. But I decided to take my family there Saturday night, and it was a true let down. First upon arrival the two hostesses were talking amongst themselves and didn't greet us or even say welcome we will be with you in one moment. Nothing not until two other parties showed up and they asked if we were waiting or had been helped and I had to loudly say no we havent been helped yet we are actually waiting to be aknowledged since they seem to be deep in their conversation. Not to mention the of the two hostesses the fat angry one and the young skinny one the fat older one was extremely rude and acted as if we were bothering her by wanting to be seated. STRIKE ONE and Strike two. Strike 3 was that there was already tables and booths open but we had to wait to be seated. Strike 4 was that I requested my burger be well done. And when I recieved it it was medium.  not medium well. not even close to being well done. AND bc I hate raw hamburger meat I sent it back. Well After everyone at my table was finished they brought my burger and not only was it now cold but it was med well not as reddish pink but still with a reddish hue and I couldnt even finish a quarter of the burger. SMH Absolutely unacceptable. I am sorry but the only saving grace was that our waiter was polite and checked on our table twice. Had he not been I would have easily said 1 star.  I should have just gone to Bernies Burger bus like I originally planned. SMH!!

Horrible. Came here prior to a movie next door with plenty of time. 20 minutes after taking the order, the waiter comes back and asks what we had ordered. Apparently, he never placed our order. Since there was no way we could get out order and not scarf it down, we told him to forget it.  Don't come here unless you want to risk either being late to your movie or scarfing your food down. Waiter did not care at all.

I haven't had a burger in awhile so a couple of friends and I decided to come to this restaurant. One of my friends actually suggested it since he knows the owners of all of the ones in Houston. Good thing he did it was a great experience.  We sat at the tables by the bar because there was a little wait and we were able to fit on one of the table tops. The server was quick and he was on point when it came to our orders and refills. I had the Royal Red Robin, if you're like me and you love eggs on everything, this is the perfect choice. Our server when asked for more fries brought to baskets just in case. Great eatery spot for convenience and great service.

Sooo I won tickets from CW39 to see Interstallar and a voucher for two dinners at Red Robin. Awesome! I'm now sitting at the table... Here's a play by play of my experience at Red Robin. Got to the restaurant with my friend, and a wait to be seated; about 15 minutes. Waited about 8 minutes before a waiter came. They looked short staff, and very busy. And yet, some tables dotted the place vacant. We've just ordered, my friend now decides to see how long it would take to fill up his water, and a countdown begins... We are now at 12 minutes. I have my margarita. Supposed to be one of the best, but could use more tequila. (That's just me tho, I like a strong margarita). Oops! Someone almost slips on some water in the restaurant! Our waiter (yes) is moping it up. 15.30 minutes... 21 minutes (waiter spotted in distance)... 24.30....waiter comes up, says the ticket was lost, but now found. They are know just putting in our order. Are you kidding me... Oh, btw, water still empty (update: 27.25) and I ordered a shot of tequila to put in my drink. 31.30. Shot of tequila arrives. We're hungry. Food!! 35.30 Water!!! 38 flat. And the burgers are pretty good. Things are coming quicker, which is nice. Used the bathroom, no paper towels, had to use toilet paper to wipe hands. Bathroom needed some TLC. Are the employees using this bathroom too? Boy... That's disgusting. I'm ready to leave. Check comes, they did discount us a bit for the "lost ticket", that was cool. But really, the meals are free remember lol, so it doesn't matter. To conclude, not a good experience for my first time at Red Robin, which I was thinking to take my fiancé. She would be pissed I brought her. Good food, not good service. Two stars - the food being the 2nd star.

I wish I can give a zero star and can write a review, by far this is the worse red robin I've ever been to. My burger was over cooked and I ordered a cup of French onion soup 3 times with 3 different people and I never get my soup. Service is so horrible here take your money to somewhere else!!!

I ordered a burger in a lettuce wrap. I was brought two pieces of lettuce and the burger with all of its toppings. In most red robins they wrap the lettuce around the burger and then in a paper wrapping. Very disappointed.

So a well meaning relative who doesn't know me very well bought me a gift certificate to Red Robin for Christmas. I really didn't want to eat here but I figured I may as well use the gc to take the fam to dinner before Zero Dark Thirty (great movie BTW). One word: Yuck. Or perhaps "meh". I have no idea why people would rather eat a burger here than anywhere else. I can name 10 different burger joints off the top of my head that run circles around this places' 'food.' LBBB, Lankford, HCG, BP, BTBS, PB, CTG, FG, Sam's Deli,  WHATABURGER!  My bf and I split the peppercorn burger. Couldn't taste anything peppercorn -y and the patty was pitiful. Seriously very blah. And I love almost all burgers I stuff into my mouth.  The only thing decent we ordered were the pretzel bites with horseradish mustard. Pretty hard to mess up those. Extra star for the the  service in the bar area which was good. Also, no one needs bottomless fries, really.

When you're craving a burger but not in the mood for the basic fast food burger joint, Red Robin will take care of you. I fixed my craving by trying the Black & Bleu burger. It's loaded with angus beef, sautéed mushrooms, caramelized onions, blue cheese, dijon sauce on a ciabatta bun and it was so damn good. My boyfriend went the safe route and built his own cheeseburger. Although you will spend more here than your average burger joint here and the fries are average, here are 3 reasons why I recommend you trying it out. 1. They have a nice variety of gourmet/ specialty burgers and soft drinks.  2. Unlimited French Fries.  3. They have vegan and healthy options.
Terrible service by everyone who helped our table, except for the waitress herself. I was really shocked quite honestly. I'll be hesitant to talk up Red Robin in the future.......

I LOVE LOVE LOVE this place. After not being here for a year, I recently went for dinner. They renovated the place and it looks absolutely amazing!! I loved the giant fries and shake made out of Legos. Our waiter was super nice and recommended some stuff to us which we ended up loving!! Something new I tried and now think is an absolute MUST is the garlic cheese fries. Wowow. I'm in love. I think Red Robin is a great place to go grab some dinner. It is in fact, my favorite burger place. They're always juicy and cooked perfectly. Will definitely be back!

My friends are worshipers of the Fast & Furious movies, and have decided to drag me out to each one of them as I am not.  To their credit, they chose a good spot to grub down next to the theater before the show. I showed up late  to this party.  And I wasn't starving, so I'm not reviewing gourmet  burgers.  Instead, I shall instead bequeath unto you my knowledge of drinks and wings.  Because I wasn't hungry, I ordered off of the expensive large sized appetizer menu.  makes perfect sense.  Bar Wings 'n' Yukon Chips in the whiskey river BBQ sauce.  It was more than I needed, which of course meant I ate all of it.  I shared, a little.  But the best part, was the Irish Beer Shake.  Yes.  A beer shake.  This is Guinness Stout, Jameson Whiskey, and chocolate ice cream.  Yeah, It's what you're imagining it to be.  Good.  Worth it.   Service can be a bit slow.  It wasn't a packed night so I can't say they were stretched for time or attention. But everything came out hot, and we had no issues.  Solid choice.

So this my second time visiting this particular red robin, trying to give this locati9n a second chance but this will be my last time going to this one off I10 west. First time I went I ordered garlic fries to go, I did not get them. This time once again I ordered garlic fries and the pic is exactly what I received. I complained and then the second time I received the correct fries. I'm just over them you get 2 chances to mess over me.

Red Robin serves decent burgers. Personally, their appeal to me is because of a couple of things: bottomless steak fries and bottomless strawberry lemonade. If this is your first time here, their menu can be overwhelming. First thing to do is to see their burgers 411 page so you know what's what. They have three kinds of burgers: Angus meat, regular meat, and tavern style (smaller size). Despite the description and the pictures that you see on the menu pages to make it sound like their burgers are as big as a mammoth, their burgers aren't actually that big. I usually always enjoy my burgers when I come here, but their prices are pretty high. For example, my Smoke & Pepper burger cost $13.99. I added a fried egg on top for an additional charge making it a $15 burger!! For that kind of money, I could have gotten a real delicious tasting burger from Stanton's City Bites and then some. My bill for the one burger + strawberry lemondae ($5!) + tax and tip was well over $25. Yeah, that's not going to do it for me. On the flip side, the service was not too bad and you can pay for your meal using one of those tabletop machines. This restaurant is also conveniently located right across from the Marq'E theater. On the down side, it's freezing in here. I'm not one to complain about a room's temperature being too cold, but even in the Houston heat, with all the A/C blasting cold and the fans on high, I was freezing. Bring a jacket if you're planning to dine here.
Great food! Cooked perfectly!! Great service from Vanessa our server!!!! We will be back!!

Sat at the bar solo, thinking I could have gotten a meal before watching a movie. Unfortunately, after 45 mins, my food didn't even arrive. I left without paying so I could catch my movie.  Please don't think you can eat before your movie, better off paying at the concession stand  for popcorn.

Every now and again, some coworkers of mine like to come here during our lunch break. I've got to say, the reason I oblige is because of the unlimited steak French fries, because it's not the quickest establishment to go to for during your lunch hour. The waitstaff is a hit or miss. I came here two weeks ago and had great service by a waitress that came by every so often to check up on us and make sure our drinks are refilled. Today, our service was not the best. The waitress took FOREVER to come back to our table to get our meal orders once after she got our drinks, and the restaurant wasn't even busy today, so it isn't as though she can blame it on the crowds. If not for the fries, I'd probably not come back.

Hopefully this doesn't include the baby roaches I found on my plate after my meal. Horrible waste of the free burger for my upcoming birthday. It's Red Robin so I had no idea expectations. My food was cold, but hey, it was free and I had a long day, so I didn't say anything. The manager said he could take care of my "free food."  I told him that I didn't ask for anything and besides, my food is free. The kicker?  He asked me if I knew where the roaches came from?   ----------------I told him I don't carry them in my pocket anymore. May be a sign that I shouldn't have a cheat meal. Yeah, that's.

This place!  They were rude and unaccommodating. AND THEN they were rude to us blaming us for their error. Repeated blame. We Just walked out. If you are a party bigger than 4, don't bother. Go to cafe adobe.

Ten years ago I dined at Red Robin once a week and found it a good value.  But, time has not been kind to the Robin.  First off, the dining area had a greasy smell... not good.  The burger menu is very extensive and after some reflection I ordered a Southern Comfort Burger. The photo showed a desirable 1/2 pound burger with caramelized onions, bacon and lettuce.  The kitchen will no longer prepare the half pound burgers rare. They said they'd do mine medium. What was served up was a very dry, very well done meat patty that was devoid of any savory goodness.  The bun was the next disappointment. My burger served on a   Chibatta roll that was chibatta in name only. The bread was soft and had the texture of an ordinary hamburger bun. Baking a roll in a square shape doesn't make it chibatta. During my meal the bun completely disintegrated making a mess of my hands.   The endless steak fries were good provided they were served hot from the oil.   The margaritas were, however, very good.  I'd certainly consider having those again.  My waitress was exceptionally attentive and moderated my response.

Going to theaters across from these folks and no time so not a lot of choice. In short 1. Do not sit under one of their red ceiling ac fans or bring a blanket with you.  2. Skip the bonsai salad as the pineapple and oranges they used had to be "canned" and probably old. 3. Some of the folks in our group liked their burgers so if this is your only choice that maybe your best bet, but their Mac & cheese was not great. Nice people/service and our food came our fast, but food quality, at least on the salads need upgrading asap
Delish! First time at this location and loved it.  They were able to accommodate my strict diet and grace great service.

Honestly this place disgusted me. I ordered a vegan Boca Patty wrapped in lettuce only veggies. First it came out on a bun. So I sent it back. Then it came back with cheese and mayo. I assumed vegan means no dairy but I have to be wrong. So I've been waiting for 30 minutes for the manager and I've seen him chatting with other customers.  not once until I asked for him did he come by to apologize for  their mistake.he did compensate us. But  his theory behind the reason my order was wrong was crap. Our waitress was nice  and under a lot of pressure. I would highly suggest the cook and staff learn what Vegan no dairy, no meat all veggies mean.

I like the burgers and the salads at Red Robin.  Service is pretty spot on the times I've been. Unfortunately, this location lacks cleanliness. It seems every time I go, the tables are a bit dirty and the floors are pretty disgusting.

I love that Red Robin has a vegan option for their burgers! I got the garden burger with a boca patty and it tasted really good! The only downside I can find is that I feel like the price is very high. I wouldn't mind paying $6-7 for the burger but I wouldn't say it's worth $10. Also the customer service was great! Our waiter was very nice

Having just moved into the neighborhood, I was excited to see there was a "gourmet" hamburger joint nearby but was disappointed by a fairly average but pricey burger accompanied by cold fries. The service was commendable, however, and the draft beer was nice and frosty. Essentially just another sports bar.

I've had mixed experiences at this particular location.  Unlike the one in Westchase, you never really know what you're going to get until you sit down and actually start being served. On a previous visit, I sat at the bar, my burger arrived quickly, my drinks arrived quickly, and my fries were promptly restocked upon request.  Of course, this was a weekday during lunch and the place was completely empty. On my last visit, service was just terrible.  My girlfriend ordered her burger well-done, but it came out roughly medium and she had to send it back.  I ordered my burger medium and it came out well-done (probably got the orders crossed because she never bothered to write it down), but I just gave up and ate it.  Another person in our group ordered sweet potato fries and got regular fries.  She literally managed to mess up three of the four orders at our table. We ended up requesting our checks early and getting the hell out of there.  We had originally planned on having milkshakes for dessert, but with how poor the experience was,  The one thing this place does consistently bad is apply discounts.  I had a $2 off offer on the aforementioned previous visit and it wasn't taken off my tab.  I had a $4 off $10+ coupon on the most recent visit and it similarly wasn't discounted.

We used to go there a lot! This time, they change whole decoration to a cheap restaurant and you won't see the pictures any more! My blue burger was totally different than the picture! Good bye Red Robin!

I've always had a great experience at Red Robin. The food is great and the bottomless fries with Red Robin seasoning are awesome! We saved about $10 by purchasing the movie ticket deal (ask about it if you're planning on seeing a movie). Definitely coming back soon!

On my recent visit noticed that they have made some changes such as portions and sizes. As well as the plates. The burgers are still good, just wish they would seasoned the chicken. But we are still big fans of the steak fries and the waitress was very atentative.

Beware of Bartender! I'm a cocktail consultant so I'm very serious about the contents of the cocktails I consume. I like to get what I pay for and at the very least, I expect to get the ingredients that are listed on the menu. I watched the bartender make my drink and he swapped ingredients. I ordered a Tropical Mai Tai- the ingredients listed on the menu are: A blend of Myer's Dark and Bacardi Select rums, Orange Curaçao, fruit juices, grenadine & sweet 'n sour.  Rather than adding Bacardi the bartender used Ron Rio- which is a very cheap rum with poor quality and gives a hangover. I called the bartender out on it and asked that he make the drink with the ingredients listed on the menu and he was abrasive. I asked to speak with the manager and he came over and justified why they used cheap liquor and said that he didn't know why the menu didn't say Ron Rio instead of Bacardi because that's what they use. I told him that we both know why Ron Rio isn't listed because no one wants to consume it, therefore the drink wouldn't sell. The manager said he would instruct the bartender to make the Mai Tai the way I asked, but the drink never came. I eventually completed my meal and asked for the check, of which I was charged for the Mai Tai. I, then, requested the charge be removed and left the establishment. Burgers are awesome! If I do ever return, I won't drink anything from here that I haven't seen made with my own eyes.

Service was too fast. There was only 3 tables when we got there including ours and our server continued to check on us every 30 seconds to see if we were ready. We were treated good but rushed as to get us out. As soon as we got our burgers our check was brought to us without asking if we wanted to order anything else. We ordered a drink and they brought it to us almost half way through our food only because we asked for it and they almost did not accept our ids because they were not from texas (we are visiting). The food was okay not as good as other red robins.
Don't order the tortilla soup unless you want corn soup!  I've never had tortilla soup like that before.  Very disappointing.   Love the Bonsai burger!!

Plenty of TVS to watch the games... Family friendly so if you can't stand whining misbehaved kids this place isn't for you... There's a wide variety of items on the menu.. I ate the blue cheese burger.. No comparison to the one at Buffalo Wild Wings.. At least they tried... Service was good but the greeters should corral all the families with kids in one area and the adult groups on another side so they are not disturbed with annoying kids... Soda was flat and the food was average at best which was a little disappointing because I had high hopes for this place... Maybe next time the food will be better and there will be less crying kids...
I am a fan of Red Robin especially when they have a turkey burger that is lettuce wrap. Yum! Great place to eat if your looking for a burger joint before or after your movies.

One of my favorite places to go eat. Their Red's Tavern Double is fantastic, and the service is quick and polite. Haven't had a bad experience yet! Plenty if sports on the TV's. If you like Fuddrucker's, try this instead.

omgosh can the staff be anymore rude? came in alone and they lady in the front refused to seat me immediately;  told me there were ONLY seats for more than one. Waited 7-10 minutes finally seated once I told her someone was coming to meet me. Took my waiter 10 min to get to me, brought me the wrong drink, took me another 10 min to get the right drink (a manager had to bring me the unsweetened tea) then the waiter never came back to check on me. Waited 10 min to refill my unlimited fries, and waited more than 10 min to get the check and another 10 min to be able to pay. When I called and spoke with Armando, the next day (he said he is the general manager) he was rude as could be, yelled at me... never will I be back to any Red Robin. There is never a need to be rude to your customers and managers need to be trained to be professional and kind to ALL customers.

The food was amazing! That's the only reason it's even getting one star. When we came in, the hostess seemed annoyed that we asked for a booth. It took more than 5 minutes for the waitress to even acknowledge our existence and we had to wave her down even to get her to come over. She was very apologetic, so I figured things would look up from there. We put our food and drink order in at the same time since we had ample time to look at the menu while we were waiting for her to greet us. During the time we were waiting we noticed at least three waitresses on their phones or talking to each other. Our waitress came back to our table one more time after we had gotten or food. We paid $5 for lemonade a each which were empty half way through and we weren't offered a refill until we asked for our check. We had to have another waitress tell our waitress to bring our check because she was too busy chatting with the other employees. I paid way too much money for no service. Should've stiffed her completely. Absolutely ridiculous. I will be contacting corporate.

The food was okay, not bad but not great. I had the mushroom swiss burger that had a mountain of mushrooms - kind of impractical. After scooping off half the mushrooms, I found the burger to be overcooked and lacking in flavor. I'm also not a fan of thick, wedge fries either. The service was poor. Room temperature was at least 82 degrees as that is the temperature at which it is too warm and mildly uncomfortable to me. Requests to turn on the AC or lower the temp were ignored. My partner and I had eaten for about 10 minutes when we were issued the check. We felt rushed and pressured to leave since the waitress kept trying to remove our plates even when there was still a lot of food on it.
Artic Cod Sandwich is delicious. Along with a cup of the clam chowder, it makes a wonderful lunch.
Solid burger joint. Darn good drink selection also. ReAson for 3 stars is that wife can never find a good healthy meal on their menu.

It reminds me of a nicer Chili's. You have your traditional burgers, fish & chips, salads, soups, etc. They do advertise an "Octoberfest" type burger, which I didn't order but did look good. It's a decent place to go to when you're going to watch a movie at the theatre across the way, but not a place that I would go out of my way to visit.
Great burgers n chicken sandwich quick service specially this location will come back before or after a movie

Caution!! The mac n' cheese comes out in this little bowl that's straight out of the oven. The waitress didn't tell me it was 500 degrees. So when I tried to move it to make more room for the burger, it burned the finger prints off three of my fingers. It was horrible.  The burger was good but difficult to eat with my hurting fingers. The manager came over to make sure I was okay but it was half hearted. He didn't really apologize for the issue, or give me confidence it wouldn't happen again.  He also didn't offer to remove anything from the bill to make up for my injury. Maybe it was because I was being nice about it...  And not making a scene? Not sure. Either way, he lost our return service because of his lack of concern.
I was going to give this place 2 stars for very bland expensive food but that was before we both got sick 2 hours later.  I threw up my burger and my fiancee's umm came out the other end.

1 star, only because yelp does not allow you to give 0 stars! Very poor management and guest service.  We used to eat there once a week since my kids loved it but we will never go back now!  A hair in my kids grilled cheese and 2nd degree burns on my kids hands from a server spilling hot sauce on them!  It took 15 minutes for a manager to approach our table.  To top it off the male manager brought us a used bottle of burn spray, set it on the table and walked away!  Only after I paid the tab and said I would call corp did the woman manager come over.  She did not address my kids burned hands at all! To add insult to injury she told me she had deleted my credit card payment and hopefully that would make me happy!  We left without eating any of our food!  Money is not the issue, servers who have no common sense to keep boiling hot sauce away of children is the issue.  2 days later I called the corp office and 3 months later I still have not received a response!!!!! Red Robin will never get mine or my families business ever again!!!  They clearly do not care about the guest!!
Great service. The food was tasty and piping hot. I ate the Mac and cheese as a side with a lettuce bun turkey burger.

I went with my friend after a movie tonight and we were both starving! We got the artichoke dip and it was greeeeeat. We both loved it.  Both of us got burgers as well. She got the mushroom one and I got the bleu ribbon burger. Our burgers tasted great, but for her, the mushrooms were completely falling out while she ate them. For me, it was just wayyyyy too big to fit into my mouth AND it kept falling apart as I ate it. Now, it really did taste great, but when I eat a burger, I want it to stay together so I can eat all the different parts of it in one bite. And we also both got mac and cheese. We were both disappointed in what we were served. It was a tiny little bowl of it and it literally looked like they put the pasta in the bowl, added cheese and microwaved it. It wasn't creamy or delicious in any way, shape or form. The service was great and the food was good overall, but we were really disappointed in the burgers and mac and cheese.

Sometimes you just want a burger.  And when you're looking for a gigantic burger with all of the toppings your heart could desire, Red Robin comes to mind.   My husband isn't fond of Red Robin because they can never get his order right.  I can defend Red Robin on this point because it is odd to get a hamburger order without the bun.  On the flip side, it's also seems like leaving off the bun decreases the work involved in assembling it, not complicate it.  This order often perplexes people working with burgers and my husband rarely gets what he ordered - no bun.   If a huge burger with the bun is what you're craving, Red Robin certainly can accommodate you.  Their giant burgers are cooked to order so you don't get the same well done burger over and over if you're hoping to get something more on the medium rare side.   This location is a great stop before catching a movie at the Edwards cinema across the way.  Don't expect anything fancy or flashy - just good old fashioned burgers made to order.  Well, I guess, as long as that order comes with a bun.

Ok, I wish I didn't have to put so much emphasis on how dreadful the hosts were... but allow me to explain in screenplay form (fitting since we went to a movie after) (Enter two attractive and hungry people, stage right.) Host 1: "Table for two?" Attractive Person 1: "Yes, thank you" Host: 1 "Ok"  (Host 1 walks over to menus, picks a few up, sorts them, and then re-stacks them.  Host 1 turns back to attractive hungry people). Host 1: "Are you two dining with us tonight?  Table for two?" (Attractive Person 1 looks around to see if he can spot a camera to make sure he isn't being Punk'd) Attractive Person 2: "Yes please" (Host 1 nods and then promptly walks behind the bar) Host 2: "Hi, welcome to Red Robin, table for 2?" (Attractive Person 1 has a look of resignation, now certain he is being Punk'd) Attractive Person 2: "Yes! That would be great" (Host 2 then also meanders off, not leading attractive people to any table, Host 1 returns) Host 1: "Hi, Welcome to Red Robin, Table for two?" (Attractive person 1 contemplates hari kari) Attractive Person 2: "Yes please..." Host 1: "Great, follow me." wtf. oh, but the bottomless steak fries, our waitress, and our burgers were all pretty darned good.

I'd rather have to lick to bottom of everyone's shoes for dinner. I loathe this place!  Over-fatty, greasy, incorrect orders. DO NOT EVER EVER ORDER any seafood dish. And I know you may say "well you shouldn't order seafood at a place that makes burgers". NO. You shouldn't put things on your menu that you can't cook.  The only plus is the fries, I will admit they're good.

I hate going to red robin. They're a typical chain just like every other establishment with burgers, chicken, salads etc.. so why the 5 stars?? As much as I say I hate going to Red Robin, I always get dragged into going by my husband. And without a doubt, Every stinking time I've been here, these amazing grill masters make my burger perfect.  I'm pretty picky about food and the way my burgers are cooked, and every single time I order, I have the best damn meal and walk away happy that I went.... I don't know why I cant just say I enjoy going, but I don't. So I guess the Red Robin and I will have a Love/Hate relationship.

Went there for my birthday, with my "free hamburger" coupon. The server was incredibly nice and efficient. He brought out a batch of fries before the burgers came out. Drink refills were always on time. The burgers and fries were perfect (as always). Then I told him it was my birthday, and asked what kind of "free crap" I could get? At the end of the meal he brought over an ice cream sundae, which I thought was larger than your typical "free" birthday sundae. Considering that one of the burgers was free, this was a VERY nice thing to do. He did receive a huge tip as a result. I couldn't have asked for a better experience.

Nice burger selection here. I haven't been let down yet. My favorite so far is the Chili Cheese Burger. The peppercorn burger is good too. Tasty, but not out of this world.The place itself feels like you're eating at the mall. The towering onion rings are something to check out.

No.  I will not be coming back here.  The veggie patty was the same that I get at all major chains.  I can handle the blahness of that.  But then the fried egg on top??  The tiny bit of yolk I did manage to find was over-cooked and rubbery.  The onion rings were passable, but the whole experience made me feel that sick feeling from low quality greasy food.  My meat-eating friend was underwhelmed as well.

Food Poisoning from Red Robin  7620 Katy Fwy                I am not a big fan of Red Robin, but my children are, or should I say were.  We ate at Red Robin on June 2, 2013  12:58 PM, and on June 3 about 14 hours later,  the three of us were suffering from  vomiting, diarrhea, stomach cramps, and dehydration.  My two children had to be placed on intravenous fluids and  $600 (ER Bill) and $78.42 (FOOD BILL) later, I am far from a satisfied customer.  My Husband was the only one who did not get sick.... he had the fish....    which by the way, he did not finish.  Lucky Him.  At least we had someone to drive us to the ER.  I've spent my last $1 at Red Robin in Texas and/or any other state.
Ahhhhhmazing!!!!! Definitely try the A1 peppercorn or Lonestar!!! I took my BF on date night ... Definitely a winner In his eyes!!! LADIES BRING YOUR GUY HERE!!!! :)

We've had nothing but great experiences here. Service is fast and friendly. Management is also friendly and on the floor helping out. They have two veggie patties - one vegan (boca burger) and one vegetarian (morningstar, I believe). Decent beer selection and bottomless fries!

Food is as expected, sometimes a little salty. My family and I frequently go to this restaurant, but have seen the service drop with each visit. Could be new staff, but, that's where training should come in to help. Saw our server busily watching sports game, or talking when not tending to tables (more tv than work).
This was horrible. We were seated at our table which had two baby roaches crawling on it!! In complete disgust we walked out.

After a horrible experience at another restaurant Red Robin restored our faith in waiters/waitresses. Our waitress Dani did an awesome job waiting on us, we were seated and with our food in less than 20 minutes! She never let out drinks go empty and was always checking on us. Thanks for a great experience we really needed it!

We discovered this location a couple of months ago and have been pleased with the service and food each time.  The burgers, bottomless fries and root beer floats are all great.  Salads are also fresh and onion rings fun too.  Service is usually good as well.  I would recommend it.

I am on a somewhat lax quest for the best hamburger around. I had never been to a Red Robin, but needless to say, I am still questing. Good fries and a good burger (although the guac on my burger had some crazy and seriously sporadic kick to it). I would definitely go back, but I wasn't really salivating over it.

The Red Robin song is really annoying, yet catchy at the same time. Perhaps that's what pushed me to venture into this hamburger joint with my sister and her boyfriend (yes, I was the third wheel. Don't mock me.) My sister and I split the Banzai burger while he went with the Bleu Cheese burger. The Banzai burger had hamburger meat with teriyaki sauce, grilled pineapple rings, mayo, American cheese, and lettuce. Weird? Oh no. It's amazing. The meat is so juicy, just like how hamburger meat should be like. The pineapple rings and the teriyaki sauce added sweetness while the mayo added a bit of tang. The combination of it all = one killer burger. Also, it's very filling. Eating just half of it will fill you up. If not, then the endless steak fries will. They're not greasy or hard- they're perfect. Soft on the inside, crispy on the outside. Their Red Robin seasoning (next to the ketchup) complements them well.  Our host was pretty friendly and didn't seem annoyed when I asked him some stupid questions, i.e.: Which one's your favorite? Is this any good? Blah? Blah blah blah? So stop by if you're craving an artery-clogging burger. Good service and good food equals a happy tummy to me!

The 3 new Black Angus burgers at Red Robin are FABULOUS! The D.G.B. (damn good burger), the Smoke & Pepper and the Black & Bleu Burgers each are wonderful.  The Black & Bleu is a fork and knife burger, the Smoke & Pepper is spicy and mouth watering and The D.G.B. stands alone as a really special burger.  All are served with Bottomless Steak Fries.
It has one of the best mushroom burgers!  A little over priced but worth it.  Plus you get bottomless steak fries!!  The waitstaff are usually friendly and prompt.   Overall the place rocks!

I give it 3 stars because the service was fast and the waitress was actually friendly. The food was just ok...I mean, I ate better burgers in my life. That cramberry mixed drink was actually good. The place was kind of clean.They should remove the part in their publicity where they say "yumm" because it was just ok, and no really yummy

It has been years since I've been to this Red Robin & now I remember why. Food is average, similar to food at a Chili's or TGIF's.  We ordered the burger w/egg all the way & the whiskey bbq burger. Both burgers had charcoal tasting burnt spots on them...yuk. Fries were good & hot. Kettle chips w/french onion dip were tasty.  Best part of the whole experience actually, was the service.  Thomas was an excellent server!  Might return if I had a coupon.

Came here several years ago with a group of people. The check had been split. There were about five of us, and two were paying in cash. The rest paid with credit card. As two of us handed the waitress our check and cash, on top of the other the rest of checks and corresponding credit cards, we specifically asked for change for the cash. She looked down at it, and said sure. She came back and said that we were short on the bill. The amount happened to be the amount we had given her cash for. We said that we had already given her the money. She claims she never got any cash from us. The manager came out, and the waitress insisted we never gave her money. The manager, instead of trying to appease us and perhaps clinging onto the small chance we'd actually return, made us pay again. Lovely experience. You couldn't pay me to return.
Ah the burgers where not that good i had better burgers than this. But the place is nice and very good services they make your oder fast.

I love Red Robin. Bottomless is my favorite word. Freckled Lemnade check. Bacon cheddar mushroom bbq sauce burger check. Steak fries with ketchup check. After utililzing the bottomless power to the extreme. 4 cups of freckled lemonade is enough to kill a small child, i was extremely full but pleasantly full. I've always been a fan of Red Robin, I'm just happy that its so close to my house now! Good for my soul, bad for my wallet.

I go to this place like about once a month just to get my burger jones on. The food is so-so and the service is so-so about par with all the other restaurant chains but hey sometimes you want something in between frou frou and mcdees then this is the joint.  I usually get the good ole American Cheeseburger ( I usually get it with bleu cheese though). Yesterday, I rolled the dice and got their Whiskey River burger (the waitress said it was their signature burger. I'm a bit leery when people recommend their "signature" this and that). It was alright. I'm not a big fan of the crunchy onion stuff though. Gimme some stinky raw onions anytime. Their all you can eat fries are pretty cool but they seem to come from a bag. My friend bit into one that wasn't all the way cooked though. Overall its a decent place with decent fare.

On some occasions I have the greatest service in the world and the other times I just have the crappiest service ever.  So its a roll of dice every time I come here.  Anyhow, when I want comfort food and have the craving for fatty burgers then Red Robin is where I go.   I usually order their specialty Royal Red Robin burger (Burger w/ bacon and a poached egg).  Sounds kinda weird but it sure is yummy!!!  It's like breakfast and lunch all in one.  This burger is GENIUS!   The fries are bottomless and seasoned.  The drinks like peach/raspberry tea and the strawberry freckled lemonade are sweet and BANANAS!  However, at times it can be inconsistent.  They are prepared at the bar, and depending upon the bartender your sweet level fluctuates.  You don't really need any appetizers here unless there's something that interests you.  Otherwise, just an entree will fill you up.

Best wings in town, hands down! I love this place. I've came here a couple of times and i must say i love it every time. i usually get the hot wings with steak fries . i must say the have the best wings. They use this spacial sauce for them that separates them from the rest of the restaurants. There steak fries are the bomb! Every table has a bottle of seasoning that i use for the fries, try them with ranch and u will love them!  Oh also they have this freckle lemonade (not sure if i spelled it right)  but its lemonade with REAL strawberry's ! yum  I get about 15 refills no lie!
